home.title: Prompt Library
home.description: Collect and share prompts for various scenarios

guide.title: User Guide
guide.description: Learn how to better use AI prompts and make AI your powerful assistant

what.title: What are Prompts?
what.content: Prompts are instructions for AI conversation. A good prompt helps AI better understand your needs and provide more accurate responses. Prompts act as a bridge for communicating with AI, and through carefully designed prompts, we can guide AI to think and respond in the way we expect.

examples.title: Basic Prompts
examples.content: Directly describe your needs, like 'Write an article about environmental protection'
examples.note: Simple but may have average results

examples.title: Structured Prompts
examples.content: Specify detailed requirements, like 'Write an 800-word article about environmental protection, including: 1. Current environmental issues 2. Individual actions 3. Future outlook'
examples.note: More likely to get expected results

how.title: How to Use?
how.intro: Using AI prompts is a step-by-step process. Let's learn how to use them effectively:

steps.title: Choose a Prompt
steps.content: Select a suitable prompt template based on your needs
steps.detail: Browse categories to find prompts that match your requirements. Each prompt is carefully designed and tested to help you complete specific tasks.

steps.title: Copy Content
steps.content: Click the copy button to copy the prompt to clipboard
steps.detail: Prompts often include best practices and specific formats, saving you time from trial and error.

steps.title: Paste and Use
steps.content: Paste the prompt into your preferred AI platform
steps.detail: We support multiple major AI platforms including ChatGPT and Claude. Each platform may have slight differences, so check platform-specific instructions.

steps.title: Adjust as Needed
steps.content: Modify the prompt content according to your specific scenario
steps.detail: Prompt templates are starting points. You can adjust them based on your needs, such as modifying keywords, adjusting tone, or adding specific requirements.

tips.title: Usage Tips
tips.intro: Master these tips to make your AI conversations more efficient:
list: Use clear and specific descriptions, avoid vague expressions
Provide necessary context to help AI better understand the scenario
Specify desired output format, including length, structure, and style
If the response isn't ideal, try follow-up questions or modify the prompt
Make good use of role settings, let AI respond as a specific identity
Break down complex questions into smaller ones
Add appropriate constraints to avoid overly divergent answers
Be patient, good conversations may need multiple adjustments

list.title: Chain of Thought
list.content: Guide AI to think step by step instead of giving direct conclusions

list.title: Role Playing
list.content: Let AI respond as a specific expert to get more professional advice

list.title: Reverse Questioning
list.content: Ask AI what not to do to help clarify boundaries

list.title: Multi-turn Dialogue
list.content: Continuously refine answers through ongoing conversation

platforms.title: Supported Platforms
platforms.intro: Different platforms have their characteristics, choosing the right one is important:

list.name: ChatGPT
list.features: General-purpose AI, suitable for most scenarios
list.tips: Supports code, articles, analysis, and more

list.name: Claude
list.features: Excels at academic and professional content
list.tips: Better for tasks requiring deep thinking

list.name: Midjourney
list.tips: Pay special attention to prompt format

requirements.format: Submit files in the specified format
requirements.quality: Prompts must be tested and produce good results
requirements.original: Content must be original or authorized by the original author

submitSteps.fork: Fork the project to your GitHub account
submitSteps.create: Create a new branch and add your prompt
submitSteps.test: Test locally to ensure correct format
submitSteps.pr: Submit a Pull Request for review
